author: MapleSim
title: DC Comics Super Heroes - 30301 Batwing (Polybag)
review:
I feel like a Polybag-A-Holic! The Batwing actually took a little while to find at my local stores, of course I had forgotten that I'd gotten one for free from my local TRU with a promotion. One set I actually don't mind having a couple of! Here's why:

Box/Instructions

Standard Polybag, but with a pretty neat looking image of the finished model firing a flick missle. I really like the dark blue background they use in the line of polybags for Batman, they are quite smart looking. And of course anything with Batman in the corner with a Batarang in my book is A-OK.

I've always disliked the little square sheets you unfold for the instructions in a Polybag, but until they switch to a stapled booklet (which will probably never happen), you make do with what you got!

Parts

A good mix of different triangular plates make up the bulk of the 45 pieces included in this set. I was surprised to find that it even had a tecnic pin to facilitate a firey engine exhaust. You can never had enough flick missles said no one ever, but it has a few of the rounded ends instead of the more common translucent cones, so they get a pass on that.

I do want to point out that there's a neat half-arch used in the nose of the plane that is a 2x2 instead of the usual 1x2, which I've not seen in any sets that I own that I can think of.

Minifigures

No minifigures, but as it's a mini-build that's expected.

The build

Very straight forward, though it did get slightly hard to figure out what's next as everything is the same colour more or less and it blends together. The instructions are just the small square fold-out kind that are normal for polybags, so as such it doesn't have the oh-so-helpful legend of what parts you need per step. With all the black it's confusing on what goes where. Looking back at the last step will help compare what's old and what's new as you go along.

The completed model

I wasn't expecting a whole lot from the model as it looks quite small and flimsy at the start, but it is actually pretty solid and is easily one of the most swooshable builds I've made in a while. Call is the modern style that the Batwing has had since it was introduced in the comics, the fact that it's in a stylish colour, or just that Batman is pretty awesome, this Batwing is a great little build and a fantastic way to spend a few minutes.

Overall opinion

You can't beat the price of a Polybag, and you can't beat the value you get in a little build with neat pieces. Even better if you got it free like I did while picking up some of the newer DC Super Heroes sets earlier this year!

As a starter set for a Batman fan or even as a palate cleanse before delving into a bigger model, this is an awesome piece that will look all the better next to the Tumbler! Multiply the epic-factor tenfold by setting it up next to your pens at your desk :)

author: Odeinoichus
title: Above the Clouds on a Pale Moon Knight
review:
Set # 30301 Batwing: Designed to match the look of the Batwing, this polybag I find to be the better of the two bat-vehicles from this year's offerings in the DC Super Heroes Theme and here's why.

Pros:

1) Design is quite impressive, using an overall larger piece count this Polybag makes a big chunky looking Batwing complete with flick-fire missiles adding more to the play value.

2) Fun to swoosh around, the Batwing looks like a squat black bat almost perfectly.

 

Cons:

1) The nose is a bit long, the length of the front section isn't as short as it should be. Though when dealing with micro-scaled polybag builds I suppose that is to be expected.

2) No printed bat symbols, the Tumbler didn't need anything like that, and even if it had been stickered 1x2 tiles instead of prints the Batwing should have at least had one symbol on it somewhere, it's such an iconic part of the most familiar iteration of the Batwing and the mythos a symbol couldn't have hurt.

 

Overall this polybag is well worth the effort of tracking down, once again it's a fun little impulse buy great as a desk toy and just fun to fly around for any age. Some parts of the design may take getting used to, like with many micro-scaled vehicles, however it is definitely something I'd recommend for fans of the vehicle, or polybags in general. If you were lucky enough to get last year's Batmobile polybag this completes the three iconic vehicles in this scale also.
